gurmukhi: ju`Du ieqo jb BUp kIE qb nwhir KwN iris kY AitkXo ] hiQAwr sMBwr hkwr pirE ju smwj mY bwj huqo mitkXo ]
transliteration: Juddh(u) Ito Jab Bhoop Keeo Tab Naahar(i) Khaan Ris(i) Kai Atteekyo|| Hathiaar Sanbhaarr Hakaar Pario Ju Samaaj Mai Baaj Houto Maatteekyo||
translation: When the king waged a dreadful war, then in great rage Nahar Khan came and stood before him; holding his weapons, with dancing horse and challenging the king, he fell upon him;

gurmukhi: KVgyS iqnY gih kysn qy JtkXo Aru BUim ibKY pitkXo ] qb qwhir KwN ieh dyK kib sXwm khY Bj gXo n itkXo ]1603]
transliteration: Khadgesh Tinai Gadh Kesan Te Jhatkyo Ar(u) Bhoom(i) Bikhai Patteekyo|| Tab Taahar(i) Khaan Ih Dekh Dashaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Bhaj Gyo Na Tikyo||1603||
translation: Kharag Singh caught him by his hair, threw him on the ground, with a jerk; seeing him in such plight, Tahir Khan did not stay there and fled away.1603.

gurmukhi: qwhir KwN Bj gXo jb hI qb hI iris Kwn JVwJV Awey ] SsqR sMBwr sBY Apuny jm rUp kIey niRp aUpir Dwey ]
transliteration: Taahar(i) Khaan Bhaj Gyo Jab Hitab Hiris(i) Khaan Jhadaajhad Aae|| Shastra Sanbhaar Sabhai Apoune Jam Roop Keee Nrip Oopar(i) Dhaae||
translation: When Tahir Khan fled away, then, in great fury, Jharajhar Khan came forward and holding his weapons fell upon the king looking like Yama;

gurmukhi: BUpiq bwn hny ien kMau ienhUM niRp kMau bhu bwn lgwey ] ikMnr j`C rrY aupmw rn cwrun jIq ky gIq bnwey ]1604]
transliteration: Bhoopat(i) Baan Hane In Kaoun Inhoon Nrip Kaoun Inhoon Nrip Kaoun Bahu Baan Lagade|| Kinnar Jachchh Darai Oupmaa Ran Chaaran Jeet Ke Geet Banaae||1604||
translation: He discharged many arrows on the king and the king shot many arrows on him; Kinnars and Yakshas praised their battle and the group of mistrels began to sing songs of victory.1604.

gurmukhi: KVg isMG liK ibkit Bt iqaur cVwey mwQ ] sIs kwit Air ko dXo eyk bwn ky swQ ]1605]
transliteration: Khadag Singh Lakh(i) Bikat Tior Chadhaae Maath|| Sees Kaattee Ar(i) Ko Dayo Ek Baan Ke Saath||1605||
translation: Kharag Singh seeing the stern warriors before him changed the signs on his forehead and with a single arrow, chopped the head of the enemy.1605.

gurmukhi: puin Kwn inhMg JVMg BVMg cly muK Fwlin kau Dir kY ] kir my krvwr sMBwr hkwr murwr pY Dwie pry Air kY ]
transliteration: Poun(i) Khaan Nihan Jhadan Bharan Chale Moukh Dhaalan(i) Kau Dhar(i) Kai|| Kar(i) Me Karvaar Sanbhaar Hakaar Muraar Pai Dhaae Dare Ar(i) Kai||
translation: Then Nihang Khan, Jharang Khan and Bharang Khan etc. marched forward, masticating their mouths with their shields; then holding his sword in his hand, the king challenged and fell upon Krishna;

gurmukhi: dlu mwr ibdwr dXo pl mY Dir muMf su mInn ijau PrkY ] n trY rnBUmhu qy qb lau jb lau iCq pY n pry mir kY ]1606]
transliteration: Dal(u) Maar Bidaar Dayo Pal Mai Dhar(i) Mounnd Su Meenan Jio Pharkai|| Na Darai Ran-bhoomoh Te Tab Lau Jab Lau Chhit Pai Na Dare Mar(i) Kai||1606||
translation: The king beat and caused the army to flee and the trunks and heads began to writhe in the battlefield like fish; the warriors did not like to withdraw from the field till their death.1606.

gurmukhi: sRonq kI srqw qhw clI mhw Airrwie ] myd mws mijXw bhuq bYqrunI ky Bwie ]1607]
transliteration: Sronat Kisartaa Thaa Mahaa Ar(i)raae|| Med Maas Majiya Bahout Baitarounike Bhaae||1607||
translation: The stream of blood flowed there in flood and it appeared like Vaitarni stream of flesh and morrow.1607.

gurmukhi: mcXo rn dwrn idlwvr dlyl KwN iscwnn kI BwNiq rn BUm JtptI sI ] htI n inpt KtptI su Btn hUM kI Awnn kI AwBw qw kI lwgY nYku ltI sI ]
transliteration: Machyo Ran Daaran Dilaavar Dalel Khaan Sichaanan Kibhant(i) Ran Bhoom Jhat-patisee|| Hatina Nipat Khat-patisu Bhatan Hoon Kiaanan Kiaanan Kiaabhaa Taa Kilaagad Naik(u) Latisee||
translation: A dreadful war began and Dilawar Khan, Dalel Khan etc., joined speedily in the war like a falcon; these fully persistent warriors are engaged in destruction and their glory seems charming to the eyes;

gurmukhi: BUpiq sMBwrkY kiRpwn pwn qwn AiBmwn kY sMGwrI sYn bcI PUtI PtI sI ] khUM bwj mwry khUM igry gj Bwry Bwry BUp mwno krI Bt ktI bn ktI sI ]1608]
transliteration: Bhoopat(i) Sanbhaar-kai Kridaan Paan Taan Abhimaan Kai Sanhaarisain Bachiphootiphatisee|| Kahoon Baaj Mdare Kahoon Gire Gad Bhdare Bhdare Bhoop Maano Karibhat Katiban Katisee||1608||
translation: The king also holding his sword; proudly smashed and destroyed the elephants, the warriors were cut down by the king like the trees cut down and thrown in the forest.1608.
